message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DM, cs.IT, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes techniques for limiting the size of focal sets of basic belief assignments (bbas) while preserving their information. This involves algorithmic and matrix-based approaches, as well as unsupervised clustering. The paper's focus on managing and optimizing information suggests a strong connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The use of algorithms and clustering also suggests connections to data mining (cs.DM) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper's focus on managing and organizing information could also suggest a connection to social and information networks (cs.SI).
